text: In this video, I'm going to explain
how to aim better in Apex Legends.
With these tips,

you will be put in the
best position possible

to defeat opponents and
become Apex champion.
Aim is the primary staple in Apex Legends,
as it is for any first-person shooter.

On top of this, every
single weapon in the game
has a unique recoil pattern
that will need to be counterbalanced

with either your mouse
or right analog stick.
To figure out these patterns,
go to the training range,

shoot every single weapon
without attachments
and without counterbalancing,

then learn the pattern and
begin trying to mirror it.

For example, if the recoil
of a gun kicks up and left,

then pull down and right
on the analog stick
or mouse when shooting that gun.
Once mastering this,

begin adding in a strafe
pattern left and right.
This will only make recoil control easier

and allow you to land more
shots on the opposition.
To further improve aim,
we can practice working on flick shots
and spray transferring.

Flick shooting is when you
quickly drag your reticle

over the enemy and take
a shot simultaneously.
This is useful in situations

where you are getting shot
from one of your blind areas

and need to readjust and
fight back right away.
Spray transferring is when
you take the shots you are firing

and transfer them to another
enemy that you deem a threat.
This is useful in situations
where you are shooting at an enemy
and one of their teammates appears
and becomes a greater threat.

Mastering these skills
will help you turn the tide
of an unexpected fight in an instant.
